newsitem.title: MALAYSIA: Tenaga shares off after drop in yr net.
newsitem.headline: Tenaga shares off after drop in yr net.

text.p: Shares of state-controlled utility Tenaga Nasional Bhd fell in morning trading on Friday after the company disappointed investors with a sharp drop in full-year profits, dealers said.
At 0153 GMT, Tenaga's stock was off 20 cents to 10.30 ringgit after falling to a low of 10.00 ringgit earlier.

Tenaga posted a 36 percent drop in net profit for the year ended August 31, 1996 to 797.8 million ringgit, versus forecasts of 1.0 billion to 1.2 billion ringgit and the year-ago profit of 1.24 billion.
"It (the decline in profit) was a bit sharper than expected," said Tony Shue, a vice president in institutional sales at Jupiter Securities.
Tenaga attributed the profit decline to a 1.22 billion ringgit or 114 percent year-on-year rise in payments to private power companies for electricity purchases.
"It appears the tariff hikes were not sufficient to offset the huge outflow to IPPs (Independent Power Producers)," said William Chan, an institutional dealer at Seagroatt and Campbell.
